content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a struct `FloatWithUnits` with fields `value` and `unit` (make sure to define it!), write a `show` method for it that will concatenate the value and unit with a space like this "1.8 meters".

To create the `FloatWithUnits` struct and define the `show` method, you can use the following code:

```julia
mutable struct FloatWithUnits
    value::Float64
    unit::String
end

function Base.show(io::IO, f::FloatWithUnits)
    println(io, string(f.value), " ", f.unit))
end
```

Now, when you create an instance of `FloatWithUnits` and print it, the `show` method will be called to display the value and unit concatenated with a space.
